article.headline: Furman 60, The Citadel 47
article.story: GREENVILLE, S.C. (AP) -- Maleye Ndoye scored a game-high 20 points as Furman beat The Citadel 60-47 on Saturday. The game gave Bulldogs their 13th straight loss. Moussa Diagne added 12 points and a game-high eight rebounds for the Paladins (15-10, 7-7 Southern Conference). Kevin Hammack scored 14 and Dante Terry 13 for the Bulldogs (4-21, 0-14), who made more turnovers (15) than field goals (13) and hit 29.5 percent of shots. Ndoye scored four to lead a 10-2 run that gave Furman a 42-32 lead after Diagne's free throw with 11:29 remaining. Six minutes later, the Paladins used a 10-3 run to post their largest lead at 59-44 on Nick Sanders' free throw with 1:35 left. Furman led 30-21 at halftime, but The Citadel opened the second half with a 9-2 run to come within two at 32-30 on Terry's 3-point shot. The win was Furman's fifth in the last six against the Bulldogs and completed a series sweep for the season.
